page.title: 15 In the news (Aldridge)
page.content: Articles in the local press in the week ending Friday, June 28, 1985 were very varied. One issue hitting the headlines continually is that of a proposed motorway near to the Copy Hall estate. Local residents have formed an action commitee to fight the proposals and are displaying many anti-motorway posters in their windows. Local residents were warned this week by Aldridge Police to be on their guard, following a series of cash and jewellery thefts from homes, one in Little Aston Road. Less seriously a local hairdresser cut a ladies hair up in a hot air balloon to raise money for charity. The Elms Pub held a Rod Stewart lookalike contest. In sport Aldridge cricket club continued it's run of success.
